ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: the Garden will be his refuge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Will surely have Paradise for abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: most surely his abode shall be Paradise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then indeed Paradise only is his destination.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, Paradise will be his abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then surely the garden-- that is the abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: surely Paradise shall be the refuge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! the Garden will be his home.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily the Garden! -that shall be his resort.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: his refuge will indeed be paradise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Their abode will be the Garden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, Paradise will be his abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: indeed, their refuge shall be Paradise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:41] Paradise will indeed be the abode: in sum the response [to idhā, ‘when’, verse 34] is that the disobedient one will be in the Fire and the obedient one in Paradise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! the Garden will be his home) Paradise will be the home of him who is thus.
